author: WKRC
title: chevron-right
text: {p}CINCINNATI (WKRC) - Some doctors who usually work with humans came together to help one of the gorillas who broke her arm at the Cincinnati Zoo.{/p}{p}{sd-embed class=\"sd-embedded-media\" data-alt=\"WKRC\" data-caption=\"(WKRC,%20Cincinnati%20Zoo)\" data-duration=\"64.256\" data-externalid=\"3a4dda842ca44c25bbf6fe9eac73443d\" data-mediatype=\"video\" data-renditions=\"\" data-thumburl=\"https://x-default-stgec.uplynk.com/ause/slices/3a4/34d28c6069b34f1d96307c80809697d7/3a4dda842ca44c25bbf6fe9eac73443d/poster_82e3855d93df477d88b401ab65125aa2.png\" data-title=\"Cincinnati%20Zoo%20gets%20help%20from%20Cincinnati%20Children's,%20UC%20Health%20and%20GE%20with%20gorilla%20injury\" data-url=\"https://content.uplynk.com/3a4dda842ca44c25bbf6fe9eac73443d.m3u8?tc=1&exp=1713565216&rn=138869942&ct=a&cid=3a4dda842ca44c25bbf6fe9eac73443d&hlsver=7&sig=c623c88ca53c3f5cb9ff84b70fa2a206c6134b3b7a2ee2c7d851709624b53857\" data-defaultthumb=\"true\" data-embed-file=\"%3Cdiv%20class=%22sda-VideoEmbed%22%3E%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%3Cdiv%20class=%22sda-video-media-no-thumb%22%3E%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%3Ciframe%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20width=%22560%22%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20height=%22315%22%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20class=%22sda-embeded-player-iframe%20sda-VideoEmbed-iframe%22%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20src=%22/resources/embeds/vod.html?externalId=3a4dda842ca44c25bbf6fe9eac73443d&thumbUrl=https%253A%252F%252Fx-default-stgec.uplynk.com%252Fause%252Fslices%252F3a4%252F34d28c6069b34f1d96307c80809697d7%252F3a4dda842ca44c25bbf6fe9eac73443d%252Fposter_82e3855d93df477d88b401ab65125aa2.png%22%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20frameborder=%22no%22%3E%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%3C/iframe%3E%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%3Cdiv%20class=%22sda-VideoEmbed-caption-no-thumb%22%3E%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%3Cspan%3ECaption:%20(WKRC,%20Cincinnati%20Zoo)%3C/span%3E%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%3C/div%3E%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%3C/div%3E%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%3C/div%3E\" data-embed-type=\"video\" contenteditable=\"false\"}{/sd-embed}{/p}{p}Gladys was hurt during a scuffle last week with two younger females in her troop.{br}{/p}{p}“It’s not unusual for gorillas to have altercations, and this one was actually a minor squabble,” said Victoria McGee, Cincinnati Zoo’s Zoological Manager of Primates. “She must have fallen in just the wrong way to break her arm, but the result was a complete, oblique fracture of her distal humerus.”{/p}{p}{sd-embed class=\"sd-embedded-media\" data-alt=\"Sajen%20and%20Kotagal.jpg\" data-caption=\"(Cincinnati%20Zoo)\" data-duration=\"\" data-externalid=\"0f77c6fb-fec6-43c1-a423-73dc9d2799de\" data-mediatype=\"image\" data-renditions=\"%7B%22large16x9%22:%7B%22blurSigma%22:-1,%22height%22:450,%22label%22:%22large16x9%22,%22scaleWidth%22:986,%22url%22:%22/resources/media/d4e68c16-8b1d-4587-a79d-1337d3a84f65-large16x9_SajenandKotagal.jpg%22,%22width%22:800,%22x%22:0,%22y%22:208,%22uuid%22:null,%22id%22:%224fbe6b78-b4fd-4c7d-8f3b-76d81f13bdbf%22,%22preciseWidth%22:null,%22preciseHeight%22:null,%22name%22:%22large16x9Url%22,%22rendition%22:%22large16x9%22,%22labelOrConvertedName%22:%22large16x9%22%7D,%22jumbo16x9%22:%7B%22blurSigma%22:-1,%22height%22:450,%22label%22:%22jumbo16x9%22,%22scaleWidth%22:1320,%22url%22:%22/resources/media/d4e68c16-8b1d-4587-a79d-1337d3a84f65-jumbo16x9_SajenandKotagal.jpg%22,%22width%22:800,%22x%22:0,%22y%22:208,%22uuid%22:null,%22id%22:%22ed503872-5431-4a73-9655-64faeca5b33e%22,%22preciseWidth%22:null,%22preciseHeight%22:null,%22name%22:%22jumbo16x9Url%22,%22rendition%22:%22jumbo16x9%22,%22labelOrConvertedName%22:%22jumbo16x9%22%7D,%22small16x9%22:%7B%22blurSigma%22:-1,%22height%22:450,%22label%22:%22small16x9%22,%22scaleWidth%22:160,%22url%22:%22/resources/media/d4e68c16-8b1d-4587-a79d-1337d3a84f65-small16x9_SajenandKotagal.jpg%22,%22width%22:800,%22x%22:0,%22y%22:208,%22uuid%22:null,%22id%22:%22cdf6364a-3748-4dc4-abeb-0f17e0a447a5%22,%22preciseWidth%22:null,%22preciseHeight%22:null,%22name%22:%22small16x9Url%22,%22rendition%22:%22small16x9%22,%22labelOrConvertedName%22:%22small16x9%22%7D,%22full16x9%22:%7B%22blurSigma%22:-1,%22height%22:450,%22label%22:%22full16x9%22,%22scaleWidth%22:800,%22url%22:%22/resources/media/d4e68c16-8b1d-4587-a79d-1337d3a84f65-full16x9_SajenandKotagal.jpg%22,%22width%22:800,%22x%22:0,%22y%22:208,%22uuid%22:null,%22id%22:%220ea7cfcb-58f1-4961-8854-5b7364933237%22,%22preciseWidth%22:null,%22preciseHeight%22:null,%22name%22:%22full16x9Url%22,%22rendition%22:%22full16x9%22,%22labelOrConvertedName%22:%22full16x9%22%7D,%22medium16x9%22:%7B%22blurSigma%22:-1,%22height%22:450,%22label%22:%22medium16x9%22,%22scaleWidth%22:648,%22url%22:%22/resources/media/d4e68c16-8b1d-4587-a79d-1337d3a84f65-medium16x9_SajenandKotagal.jpg%22,%22width%22:800,%22x%22:0,%22y%22:208,%22uuid%22:null,%22id%22:%22b6f921c8-f24c-4de8-a30a-0ccb0db511a0%22,%22preciseWidth%22:null,%22preciseHeight%22:null,%22name%22:%22medium16x9Url%22,%22rendition%22:%22medium16x9%22,%22labelOrConvertedName%22:%22medium16x9%22%7D%7D\" data-thumburl=\"/resources/media/d4e68c16-8b1d-4587-a79d-1337d3a84f65-medium16x9_SajenandKotagal.jpg\" data-title=\"Cincinnati%20Zoo%20gets%20help%20from%20Cincinnati%20Children's,%20UC%20Health%20and%20GE%20to%20help%20gorilla\" data-url=\"\" data-defaultthumb=\"true\" data-embed-file=\"%0A%20%20%20%20%3Cdiv%20class=%22sda-ImageEmbed%22%3E%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%3Cimg%20src=%22/resources/media/d4e68c16-8b1d-4587-a79d-1337d3a84f65-medium16x9_SajenandKotagal.jpg%22%20alt=%22%22%20/%3E%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%3Cdiv%20class=%22sda-ImageEmbed-caption%22%3E(Cincinnati%20Zoo)%3C/div%3E%0A%20%20%20%20%3C/div%3E\" data-embed-type=\"image\" contenteditable=\"false\"}{/sd-embed}{/p}{p}The break Gladys suffered is not a common injury at the zoo so it brought in surgeons from Cincinnati Children's Hospital and anesthesiologists from the University of Cincinnati College of Medicine.{br}{/p}{p}{sd-embed class=\"sd-embedded-media\" data-alt=\"xray%20before%202.jpg\" data-caption=\"(Cincinnati%20Zoo)\" data-duration=\"\" data-externalid=\"97c31044-4dde-4ac7-a548-86023e6262eb\" data-mediatype=\"image\" data-renditions=\"%7B%22large16x9%22:%7B%22blurSigma%22:-1,%22height%22:1701,%22label%22:%22large16x9%22,%22scaleWidth%22:986,%22url%22:%22/resources/media/97c31044-4dde-4ac7-a548-86023e6262eb-large16x9_xraybefore2.jpg%22,%22width%22:3024,%22x%22:0,%22y%22:1166,%22uuid%22:null,%22id%22:%22497bd1c1-8ae8-4d13-9074-be8bc4628370%22,%22preciseWidth%22:null,%22preciseHeight%22:null,%22name%22:%22large16x9Url%22,%22rendition%22:%22large16x9%22,%22labelOrConvertedName%22:%22large16x9%22%7D,%22jumbo16x9%22:%7B%22blurSigma%22:-1,%22height%22:1701,%22label%22:%22jumbo16x9%22,%22scaleWidth%22:1320,%22url%22:%22/resources/media/97c31044-4dde-4ac7-a548-86023e6262eb-jumbo16x9_xraybefore2.jpg%22,%22width%22:3024,%22x%22:0,%22y%22:1166,%22uuid%22:null,%22id%22:%228fe34352-b0ee-45d4-9678-9dfab1d598c4%22,%22preciseWidth%22:null,%22preciseHeight%22:null,%22name%22:%22jumbo16x9Url%22,%22rendition%22:%22jumbo16x9%22,%22labelOrConvertedName%22:%22jumbo16x9%22%7D,%22small16x9%22:%7B%22blurSigma%22:-1,%22height%22:1701,%22label%22:%22small16x9%22,%22scaleWidth%22:160,%22url%22:%22/resources/media/97c31044-4dde-4ac7-a548-86023e6262eb-small16x9_xraybefore2.jpg%22,%22width%22:3024,%22x%22:0,%22y%22:1166,%22uuid%22:null,%22id%22:%22aa13089f-64bd-4944-9102-554b8a1974eb%22,%22preciseWidth%22:null,%22preciseHeight%22:null,%22name%22:%22small16x9Url%22,%22rendition%22:%22small16x9%22,%22labelOrConvertedName%22:%22small16x9%22%7D,%22full16x9%22:%7B%22blurSigma%22:-1,%22height%22:1701,%22label%22:%22full16x9%22,%22scaleWidth%22:3024,%22url%22:%22/resources/media/97c31044-4dde-4ac7-a548-86023e6262eb-full16x9_xraybefore2.jpg%22,%22width%22:3024,%22x%22:0,%22y%22:1166,%22uuid%22:null,%22id%22:%22542c0797-a1a4-4dfe-aa7b-206dd573ff45%22,%22preciseWidth%22:null,%22preciseHeight%22:null,%22name%22:%22full16x9Url%22,%22rendition%22:%22full16x9%22,%22labelOrConvertedName%22:%22full16x9%22%7D,%22medium16x9%22:%7B%22blurSigma%22:-1,%22height%22:1701,%22label%22:%22medium16x9%22,%22scaleWidth%22:648,%22url%22:%22/resources/media/97c31044-4dde-4ac7-a548-86023e6262eb-medium16x9_xraybefore2.jpg%22,%22width%22:3024,%22x%22:0,%22y%22:1166,%22uuid%22:null,%22id%22:%22d8d6c64d-a85b-4b64-9d48-20c8cc99c0d3%22,%22preciseWidth%22:null,%22preciseHeight%22:null,%22name%22:%22medium16x9Url%22,%22rendition%22:%22medium16x9%22,%22labelOrConvertedName%22:%22medium16x9%22%7D%7D\" data-thumburl=\"/resources/media/97c31044-4dde-4ac7-a548-86023e6262eb-medium16x9_xraybefore2.jpg\" data-title=\"Cincinnati%20Zoo%20gets%20help%20from%20Cincinnati%20Children's,%20UC%20Health%20and%20GE%20to%20help%20gorilla\" data-url=\"\" data-defaultthumb=\"true\" data-embed-file=\"%0A%20%20%20%20%3Cdiv%20class=%22sda-ImageEmbed%22%3E%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%3Cimg%20src=%22/resources/media/97c31044-4dde-4ac7-a548-86023e6262eb-medium16x9_xraybefore2.jpg%22%20alt=%22%22%20/%3E%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%3Cdiv%20class=%22sda-ImageEmbed-caption%22%3E(Cincinnati%20Zoo)%3C/div%3E%0A%20%20%20%20%3C/div%3E\" data-embed-type=\"image\" contenteditable=\"false\"}{/sd-embed}{/p}{p}After surgery, a temporary cast was put on Gladys.{br}{/p}{p}GE Additive is working to create a custom 3D-printed cast made of titanium which should be ready Friday.{/p}{p}“Gladys is naturally curious about her new cast, and she doesn’t fully understand the need to preserve it for her recovery,” explained Dr. Mike Wenninger, Cincinnati Zoo’s Director of Animal Health. “So, we turned to our friends at GE [Additive] to help us create a sturdier cast.”{/p}{p}“Gorillas hang from their arms, which is very different from a lot of the pediatric patients we care for. It’s also difficult to help Gladys understand what we have done surgically and why we need to protect the repair,” said Dr. Jaime Denning, Orthopedic Surgeon Liaison for Trauma at Cincinnati Children’s. “That’s why we needed to use heavier-duty equipment and a stronger cast. We look forward to seeing Gladys get back to hanging once she heals.”{/p}{p}Gladys will be behind the scenes for at least six more weeks. Her care team is monitoring her closely and providing around-the-clock observation and treatments to make sure that she is getting what she needs. They are also distracting her as needed to prevent the temporary cast from being destroyed.

author: Emilio Fernández
title: Detienen a presunto extorsionador de vendedor de pollo en Toluca | El Universal
text:
Toluca, Méx. Un hombre acusado de querer extorsionar a un vendedor de pollo fue arrestado por elementos de la Secretaría de Seguridad del Estado de México y de la Policía Municipal de Toluca. Integrantes de las dos corporaciones realizaban patrullajes en la capital mexiquense cuando les informaron vía radio que varios vecinos mantenían retenida a una persona.
Los oficiales se trasladaron a Paseo Matlatzincas, a la calle Subida de los Álamos, en la colonia Lomas Altas, donde hicieron contacto con la víctima , quien informó que recibió una nota de papel con un mensaje en el que se le exigía dinero por realizar su oficio y señaló al sujeto que tenían como el responsable de haber hecho la amenaza.
Lee también FOTOS: Efectos de frente frío crean extraño agujero en el cielo de Chiapas
Los uniformados detuvieron a Jesús “N”, de 24 años de edad y lo llevaron ante la Agencia del Ministerio Público correspondiente, para definir su situación jurídica.
Según las corporaciones mexiquenses, el sospechoso al parecer pertenece a una célula del grupo delictivo con orígenes en Michoacán y cuya función dentro de la estructura criminal era hacer llegar mensajes intimidatorios a los comerciantes para que paguen una cuota en las inmediaciones y periferia del mercado 16 de septiembre de la capital mexiquense.
En caso de negarse, amenazan con atentar contra la integridad física de los locatarios y sus familias.
Lee también Buscan a 14 desaparecidos, entre ellos 4 niños, tras enfrentamiento con La Familia Michoacana en Texcaltitlán
Las autoridades pidieron a la población que si identifica al acusado de ser responsable de la comisión de otro delito lo denuncie.
Se reportan dos microsismos en la CDMX
Únete a nuestro canal ¡EL UNIVERSAL ya está en Whatsapp!, desde tu dispositivo móvil entérate de las noticias más relevantes del día, artículos de opinión, entretenimiento, tendencias y más.

author: Tim Schmitt
title: This island golf paradise has sea and mountain views (and the pool!)
text:
Windy, wild weather has taken much of the country by storm this week. And while it’s fun to think about a short golf getaway to somewhere in warmer climes, what about permanently relocating to a place you can enjoy year-round?
Such is the case on the tiny island of Mauritius, a tiny island off the African coast that’s home to about 1.2 million residents and some of the most beautiful views on the planet.
This villa boasts sea, golf and mountain views, all alongside the Ernie Els-designed Anahita Golf Club. When you’re done with 18, it’s easy to dip in the 25-meter pool that could entertain quite the crew of golf buddies.
From the listing at Sotheby’s:
Located next to the stunning swimming pool, the large open plan kitchen and living space are the heart of this exquisite villa. Each of the rooms has been individually decorated and feature bespoke, locally made furniture throughout.
With beautifully designed spaces inside and out, Villa Extraordinaire is the perfect space to bring the whole family together.
Foreign ownership: access to Mauritian residence permit and a favourable fiscal climate.
And of course, there’s the weather. With temperatures in the summer hovering in the 80s and in the winter still jumping consistently into the 70s, this could be the perfect place if you’ve had enough shoveling.
Here are some stunning images of the property:

author: Federico Giuliani
title: \"Kiev non può intercettarlo\": cosa sappiamo del nuovo missile sperimentale di Putin
text:
Non era un Icbm. Il misterioso missile [lanciato nelle scorse ore](/news/guerra/russia-ha-lanciato-missile-balistico-intercontinentale-2401114.html) dalla Russia sull'Ucraina era un "missile balistico sperimentale a medio raggio", come ha spiegato [Vladimir Putin](/persone/vladimir-putin-131585.html) in persona in occasione dell'ultimo discorso rivolto ai suoi connazionali. La nebbia intorno all'arma utilizzata da Mosca è ancora fitta, ma unendo tutte le informazioni disponibili otteniamo un quadro più completo. Il capo del Cremlino ha parlato espressamente di un missile balistico a medio raggio ipersonico Oreshnik. Si tratterebbe di un jolly temibile, capace potenzialmente di lanciare più testate nucleare in contemporanea, e che, soprattutto, Kiev non sarebbe in grado di intercettare.
Il nuovo missile lanciato dalla Russia
"In condizioni di combattimento, è stato effettuato un test di uno degli ultimi sistemi missilistici russi a raggio intermedio. In questo caso, con una versione ipersonica non nucleare di un missile balistico", ha dichiarato Putin. Il Pentagono ha spiegato che il progetto dell'Oreshnik, ancora in fase sperimentale, si baserebbe su quello dell'Icbm a lungo raggio Rs-26 Rubezh. Sarebbe inoltre stato lanciato con una testata convenzionale. "Potrebbe però essere riadattato per trasportare sicuramente diversi tipi di testate convenzionali o nucleari", ha affermato la portavoce del Pentagono, Sabrina Singh.
Fonti statunitensi e britanniche citate dal Guardian ritengono che il missile, indirizzato su Dnipro, potrebbe raggiungere una velocità di 12.000 chilometri all'ora e che avrebbe una gittata teorica di poco inferiore ai 5.500 chilometri: un raggio sufficiente per raggiungere l'Europa, da dove è stato lanciato nella Russia sud-occidentale, ma non gli Stati Uniti. Timothy Wright, dell'International Institute for Strategic Studies, ha dichiarato che lo sviluppo di nuovi missili da parte della Russia potrebbe influenzare le decisioni dei membri della Nato in merito a quali sistemi di difesa aerea acquistare e quali capacità offensive perseguire per sostenere l'Ucraina.
Un messaggio alla Nato
A proposito di Nato, l'uso dell'Oreshnik sarebbe "una risposta ai piani degli Stati Uniti di produrre e schierare missili a corto e medio raggio", ha riferito Putin. "Non ci sono stati contatti con l'amministrazione in carica. D'altro canto, la dichiarazione di Putin di ieri è stata abbastanza esaustiva, chiara e logica. Quindi, non abbiamo dubbi che l'amministrazione in carica a Washington abbia avuto la possibilità di studiare e comprendere questa dichiarazione", ha spiegato il portavoce del Cremlino, Dmitry Peskov.
La Russia, lanciando il missile balistico Oreshnik, ha chiaramente dimostrato la sua capacità di rispondere alle azioni dell'Occidente, ha aggiunto Peskov. "Anche i contorni di ulteriori azioni di risposta se le nostre preoccupazioni non verranno prese in considerazione sono chiaramente delineati", ha aggiunto.
Il messaggio principale della dichiarazione di Putin è che "le decisioni sconsiderate dell'Occidente di fornire missili all'Ucraina e di attaccare il territorio russo non possono rimanere senza risposta", ha sottolineato l'alto funzionario del Cremlino. L'escalation, nel frattempo, prosegue.- dal lunedì al venerdì dalle ore 10:00 alle ore 20:00
- sabato, domenica e festivi dalle ore 10:00 alle ore 18:00.

author: Get News
title: Empowering the Future of Medicine: Announcing the Dr. Mahmud Kara Scholarship for Future Doctors Winner | User | mammothtimes.com
text:
Dr. Mahmud Kara Valley View, Ohio - Dr. Mahmud Kara , a distinguished medical practitioner with over three decades of experience, is thrilled to announce the recipient of the inaugural Dr. Mahmud Kara Scholarship for Future Doctors. This esteemed scholarship, established in recognition of Dr. Kara's remarkable contributions to the medical field, aims to nurture visionary minds in medicine.
The Dr. Mahmud Kara Scholarship for Future Doctors offers undergraduate students across the nation a unique opportunity to showcase their innovative ideas and commitment to transforming healthcare. With a generous one-time award of $1,000, this scholarship not only honors academic excellence but also celebrates the potential impact that emerging doctors can have on the global healthcare landscape.
As part of the application process, the winner participated in an engaging essay contest, where they demonstrated their innovative approaches to healthcare and their commitment to positive change in the field.
The Dr. Mahmud Kara Scholarship for Future Doctors serves as a beacon of hope and opportunity for aspiring medical professionals, transcending mere monetary recognition. Beyond its financial support, this scholarship embodies a profound commitment to nurturing the next wave of healthcare visionaries and leaders. It signifies a dedication to fostering a culture of excellence, compassion, and innovation within the medical community.
By providing this scholarship, Dr. Mahmud Kara aims to inspire and empower young minds to push the boundaries of conventional medicine, encouraging them to explore new avenues of research, treatment modalities, and patient care practices. This commitment to innovation is essential in addressing the evolving challenges and complexities of modern healthcare.
Moreover, the scholarship fosters a sense of community and collaboration among recipients, creating a network of like-minded individuals who share a passion for advancing healthcare and improving patient outcomes. Through mentorship, networking opportunities, and ongoing support, recipients of the Dr. Mahmud Kara Scholarship for Future Doctors are encouraged to continue their journey of growth and development as compassionate healers and change-makers in the field of medicine.
Ultimately, this scholarship is not just about recognizing academic achievement; it is about investing in the future of healthcare. It is about nurturing the potential of young doctors to become leaders who will drive positive change, improve access to quality care, and make meaningful contributions to the well-being of individuals and communities worldwide. In this way, the Dr. Mahmud Kara Scholarship for Future Doctors embodies a profound commitment to shaping a brighter, healthier future for all.
Please join us in congratulating our winner for their outstanding achievement and in celebrating the bright future they embody for the field of medicine.
About Dr. Mahmud Kara :
Dr. Mahmud Kara is a highly esteemed medical professional with over three decades of experience. In 2017, he founded KaraMD, an online platform dedicated to supporting digestive health, heart health, and overall well-being. Dr. Kara's commitment to advancing medical knowledge and empowering future doctors continues to inspire individuals globally.

Email: Send Email

State: Ohio
Country: United States
Website: https://drmahmudkarascholarship.com

author: تحيا مصر
title: جروبات الغش تدعي تداول أسئلة امتحان مادة التاريخ للثانوية العامة لطلاب الشعبة الأدبية
text:
مشاهدة جروبات الغش تدعي تداول أسئلة امتحان مادة التاريخ للثانوية العامة لطلاب الشعبة
يذكر بـأن الموضوع التابع لـ جروبات الغش تدعي تداول أسئلة امتحان مادة التاريخ للثانوية العامة لطلاب الشعبة الأدبية قد تم نشرة ومتواجد على
تحيا مصر وقد قام فريق التحرير في برس بي بالتاكد منه وربما تم التعديل علية وربما قد يكون تم نقله بالكامل اوالاقتباس منه ويمكنك قراءة ومتابعة مستجدادت هذا الخبر او الموضوع من مصدره الاساسي.
وختاما نتمنى ان نكون قد قدمنا لكم من موقع Pressbee تفاصيل ومعلومات، جروبات الغش تدعي تداول أسئلة امتحان مادة التاريخ للثانوية العامة لطلاب الشعبة الأدبية.
في الموقع ايضا :
